qas.question: What other city merged with Southampton after the 2001 census?
What's the other name for South Hampshire?
In the 2011 census, what was the population of Southampton after it merged with Portsmouth?
What metropolitan area is Portsmouth a part of?
What is the estimated minimum population of South Hampshire?

context: In the 2001 census Southampton and <a0_0>Portsmouth<a0_0/> were recorded as being parts of separate urban areas, however by the time of the 2011 census they had merged to become the sixth largest built-up area in England with a population of <a2_0>855,569<a2_0/>. This built-up area is part of the metropolitan area known as <a3_0>South Hampshire<a3_0/>, which is also known as <a1_0>Solent City<a1_0/>, particularly in the media when discussing local governance organisational changes. With a population of over <a4_0>1.5 million<a4_0/> this makes the region one of the United Kingdom's most populous metropolitan areas.
